medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain for about 6 months, worsening 2 weeks prior to admission.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced intermittent RUQ/epigastric pain for approximately 6 months, which worsened 2 weeks ago. One day prior to admission, she reported severe RUQ pain accompanied by nausea and non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. She also noted some subjective fever but denied chills.
medical_history.family_history: Uncle with diabetes; otherwise denies history of diabetes, hypertension, heart disease, or cancer in family. Mother and father are both alive and well without medical problems.
